page.title: 17St. Mary's Church, Cogges.
page.content: St. Mary's was built in 1150 next to the Priory which had been established by Bishop Odo after the Norman Conquest Part of the Priory still survives as a part of the rectory. Originally the church had wall paintings inside. It is quite a small church and can just about accommodate a hundred people. It has a rare chalice made in Elizabethan times. The congregation is about 100 each Sunday but can be 150 at Christmas or Easter or at Harvest Festival. The Vicar is also in charge of the small Parish and church at South Leigh. At the moment there are about 25 weddings and 20 funerals each year at this church. About 60 children go to Sunday School. William Blake is buried here and our Primary school is named after him. The school was originally set up in the Tithe Barn next to the church.
